titleStmt.title: A dog of vvar, or, The trauels of Drunkard, the famous curre of the Round-Woolstaple in Westminster His seruices in the Netherlands, and lately in France, with his home returne. By Iohn Taylor. The argument and contents of this discourse is in the next page or leafe.
titleStmt.author: Taylor, John, 1580-1653.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I Perse I, for O perse O, and & perse &, and are to be solde at the signe of the Æ dipthong,

notesStmt.note: Dated on C5r: This storie's writ the day and yeare, that seacoales were exceeding deere.
With a half-title: A dogg of vvarre.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

place.placeName: the signe of the Æ dipthong
